subject: Law
title: The Death Penalty Debate
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Death Penalty Debate.

hook.text: Since 1973, over 190 people on death row have been exonerated. They were innocent but nearly executed.

buildup.text: Capital punishment remains legal in 27 US states, though actual executions are increasingly rare.

discovery.text: Furman v. Georgia (1972) temporarily halted executions. Gregg v. Georgia (1976) allowed them under new procedures.

twist.text: Studies show no reliable evidence that the death penalty deters crime more effectively than life imprisonment.

climax.text: Racial and economic disparities in death sentencing remain a central criticism of the system.

punchline.text: The ultimate punishment demands ultimate certainty. We don't always have it.

quiz.question: Which case temporarily halted the death penalty in the US?
